stocks.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 22nd
stocks.news:
Tesla Cuts Prices:

Tesla (TSLA +0.03%) announced that it is dropping the price of its Cybertruck to try and spark more demand.

The EV company said that a new, cheaper version of the Cybertruck will start at around $60k.

It also will lower the price of its Cyberbeast, a higher-end model of the truck, to around $99k.

economy.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 22nd
economy.commentary:
Court Strikes The Tariff:

The U.S. Supreme Court struck down President Trump's 10% tariff, 6-3.

The ruling said the 1977 law Trump used to enact the tariffs didn't give him the "power to unilaterally impose tariffs of unlimited amount, duration, and scope."

The catch? Trump called the ruling a "disaster" and signaled there are other paths to keeping tariffs in place.

crypto.note: *Numbers as of market close on Feb 22nd
crypto.commentary: Small investors are buying bitcoin. It now needs bigger players to show up to continue the momentum and drive prices higher in 2026.

real_estate.homebuilder: Vallejo-based modular homebuilder Harbinger Production (formerly Factory_OS) has warned employees of potential mass layoffs affecting nearly 290 workers due to a production gap and funding challenges.
real_estate.commentary:
The Bay Area market enters the spring season as a strong seller's market with extremely tight supply. While single-family home prices in Alameda County are up nearly 3% year-over-year, the condominium market is softening with extended days on market and declining median prices.

Latest Real Estate News in the Bay Area:

• Fremont Market Momentum: The market in Fremont is starting 2026 with more activity than expected, recording 53 homes sold and 69 pending in the most recent monthly cycle. Showings have increased across the board, with well-located single-family homes drawing immediate interest and decisive action from buyers.

• Divergent Trends in the East Bay: A clear split has emerged between property types; single-family homes in Alameda County sell in a median of 19 days, while condominiums now sit for a median of 51 days. This divergence offers greater negotiating leverage for buyers in the condo segment compared to the highly competitive single-family market.

• Critical Inventory Shortages: Supply levels remain significantly lower than last year, with total inventory for single-family homes and condos down approximately 18% to 20% year-over-year. In Alameda County, inventory represents only 1.1 months of supply, signaling intense competition as the peak spring demand period approaches.

Latest General News in the Bay Area:

• BART Service Updates: BART has resumed normal train service through the Transbay Tube following earlier disruptions. However, riders on the Antioch Line should still expect roughly 20-minute delays between Antioch and Pittsburg/Bay Point due to ongoing track maintenance.

• Fremont Public Safety: Local authorities continue to investigate a fatal shooting that occurred earlier this month near Central Avenue and Joseph Street. This incident, which marked the city's second homicide of 2026, remains an active investigation by the Crimes Against Persons Unit.

• Milpitas Community Notice: Residents are reminded that community resources and transit updates remain steady, with local advisories focused on infrastructure improvements and ongoing BART escalator modernizations at nearby transit hubs.
